div.span: Southington Local Schools will cancel classes and all school activities as directed by Governor DeWine through the end of the school year.

span.strong: Â Ohio Department of Education Awards

div.span: Southington SchoolsÂ earned an overall letter grade of an "A" in theÂ Value Added Component for the District. (

Southington Schools earned an overall letter grade of a "B" on our most recent report card.Â Â Out of the three local counties, no district received an overall letter grade of an "A".Â Â Please read more about it.Â (

img.span: The Ohio Department of Education has named our school aÂ 2018 High Progress School of Honor based on our schoolâ€™s 2017-2018 Ohio School Report Card.

br.span: As aÂ Momentum Award winner, our districtâ€™s report card shows our district is committed to its studentsâ€™ success by ensuring students exceeded the growth expectations in English language arts and mathematics.

img.span: As an Overall AÂ Award winner, our schoolâ€™s report card shows our school is demonstrating high academic performance and building bright futures for students of every background and ability level.

h3.a: Food Distribution 10-12 drive to back of building.

span.div: The book fair will be held virtually through Scholastic BooksÂ April 27th-May 10th.Â Â Please use the link provided for further information.

h3.span: Food Pick Up & Completed Assignment Drop Off

span.div: Food Pick Up will be Wednesday from 10:00 a.m.--12:00 p.m. at the back of the building.Â Â

Completed assignments can be dropped off Tuesday, Wednesday, andÂ Thursday from 7:00 a.m.--7:00 p.m. at the front of the building.Â Please be sure to include student name and teacher name when returning completed packets.Â

span.div: Click HERE now to order your 2019-2020 Chalker Yearbook. Pre-orders are on sale Â NOW for only $50. This price is valid now throughÂ May 31, 2020. Â We will NOT order extra books. All copies MUST be pre-ordered.Â Â

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.span:
We are back into the swing of things after a well-deserved break. Â Everyone is now working extremely hard in preparing for our state â€“ wide assessments. Â We have been fortunate the last few years with our results. Â As we always mention, school success cannot be achieved without the cooperation of the entire school community. Â You have been excellent in working with us to achieve our goals and we THANK YOU as we hope for positive results. Â Â Â Â Switching gears a bit, we must say that we have been fortunate with the weather. Â However, as we all know it could hit us at any time. Â With that being said, your childrenâ€™s safety is our number one concern and our goal is to let you know as early as possible with any school adjustments. Â Two â€“ hour delays are not popular but sometimes we need to utilize them. Â The less instructional time we miss the better. Â Letâ€™s keep our fingers crossed. Â Â Â THANKS AGAIN WE HOPE TO SEE YOU AT ONE OF OUR SCHOOL ACTIVITIES! GO WILDCATS!
Educationally yours,
Rocco Nero
Superintendent of Schools
Southington Local
Â
